reviewText: This is a fine family-oriented film which fortunately doesn't dwell on religion or become preachy, like similar releases. The cast all turn in nice performances and kids should enjoy the focus on horses and trick-riding training and contests. There is a mild romance aspect to keep things interesting in that department, too!
Great movie  Share love of family respect and God
I would have given a higher review had the leading actress not worn those low cut dresses.  Good story line.
Daughter loves the movie.  The best acting is done by the horses IMO.

A nice message film suitable for the whole family. Loved the horses and the story. Acting was predictable, as was the story telling.

As someone who has read the series and followed the blog while the movie was being filmed, This was done very beautifully.  As with so many movies which start out as a written book and changed to fit for the big screen.  I feel this was so much better than I had hoped it would be.  I rented the movie on Amazon, and I'll be buying a copy as this is one I want in my collection to watch every time I need a beautiful movie about God and Love.  We need more inspirational movies out there for families to enjoy together.  You could see and feel the chemistry between the two main actors, which helped to cement the story together. The horses were all well trained and the reining was top notch and fun to watch.  When I read the books in this series I said it needs to be made into a movie as the story felt so real and I'm am so glad it was made into this movie.
Like

We really enjoyed this movie.  The horse performances were top-notch; the romance was handled nicely; and the Christian elements flowed naturally through the story-line.  Actors did they're jobs well,
